thread.title: Vivo Energy eyes float on London, Johannesburg exchanges

title: Vivo Energy eyes float on London, Johannesburg exchanges
text:
April 10, 2018 / 6:46 AM / Updated 31 minutes ago Vivo Energy eyes float on London, Johannesburg exchanges Reuters Staff 1 Min Read 
(Reuters) - Vivo Energy, retailer and marketer of Shell-branded ( RDSa.L ) fuels and lubricants in Africa will float on the London Stock Exchange and the Johannesburg Stock Exchange, the company said on Tuesday. People walk past the London Stock Exchange Group offices in the City of London, Britain, December 29, 2017. REUTERS/Toby Melville 
Admission is occur in May, subject to market conditions. Vivo was established in December 2011 through the carve-out of Shell’s African downstream business and had adjusted earnings before interest, tax, depreciation and amortization of $376 million (£265.8 million) in 2017, up from $302 million in 2016. Reporting by Dasha Afanasieva, editing by Sinead Cruise
